messages: 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:04): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, I don't know if http://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=10267 is actually an issue in WebIDL -- I haven't read it, so it might clearly specify the result.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:05): It's poor form to file bugs against a spec you haven't read.  :)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:17): http://dev.w3.org/2006/webapi/WebIDL/#delete

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:18): Yes, I looked at the spec and saw that part, but didn't really understand it.  I think I was told that the correct answer was to silently ignore the delete, and IIRC I filed a bug against Chrome for it.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:19): https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=43224
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:19): "If property with name P on object O has the DontDelete attribute, return false." prolly means silently ignoring

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:24): notes that of the 15 WebKit bugs he's filed, 7 have gotten any response at all that was relevant to the bug, and 4 have gotten a response longer than one comment with no follow-ups
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:26): Whereas of the 16 Mozilla bugs I've filed, only one has received no response.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:27): And only three have received just one response, of which one was INVALID with a legitimate reason, and one was DUPLICATE.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:29): And of my six Chromium bugs, four are resolved, and one I just filed a few days ago and it's in the process of being resolved.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:29): Maybe I should re-report all my WebKit bugs as Chromium bugs.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:32): I guess there's no real project QA
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:32): at least of the kind that goes through incoming bug reports

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:32): I've filed two or three Opera bugs too, but I have no idea what happened to them.  Of the two IE bugs I filed, one got a "we've confirmed the problem" and the other got no response.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:33): Of course, this is somewhat biased by the fact that my median Mozilla bug is surely older than my median WebKit bug, but still.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:33): . . . also, I don't think more of the Mozilla bugs are actually *fixed*.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:35): if you want follow-up to Opera bugs, feel free to give me bug numbers
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:35): s/numbers/IDs/
e04aa5104d082e4a51d241391941ba26 (19:36): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762, re mozilla bugs: I've seen some take over a year to get fixed
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:36): e04aa5104d082e4a51d241391941ba26, um, there are Mozilla bugs that have been open for ten years.
e04aa5104d082e4a51d241391941ba26 (19:36): re chrome bugs, of which I've filed 1, it got fixed within 3 days
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:36): But it's nice to at least receive an indication that someone has looked at the bug and confirmed it's an issue.
e04aa5104d082e4a51d241391941ba26 (19:36): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762, yeah I know - longest mozilla bug I've seen open/unconfirmed is 5 years
e04aa5104d082e4a51d241391941ba26 (19:37): I've seen some open longer - but with activity ;-)

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:37): Yeah, that's my experience too.  Chromium bugs get dealt with extremely quickly, Mozilla gets a response but is less likely to be fixed immediately, WebKit is usually ignored, Opera I can't tell, IE I'm not sure in general because I've only filed two bugs.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:37): Probably it varies by component somewhat.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:38): might also depend on the issue
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:39): e.g. Chromium also has 16964 unresolved issues :)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:39): which is more or less the same for every browser
e04aa5104d082e4a51d241391941ba26 (19:39): I'd love to figure out the statistics for avergage time to response and average time to completion ;-)
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:39): But that's biased by the nature of the issues filed.
e04aa5104d082e4a51d241391941ba26 (19:40): also - chrome has far fewer features and is newer so it has less code bloat. So most issues can be dealt with fairly fast
e04aa5104d082e4a51d241391941ba26 (19:40): Mozilla has some really ugly and old code

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:40): Probably Opera and IE get the fewest (and highest-quality?) issues filed, because of poor visibility and poor usability.  WebKit and Mozilla probably more.  Chromium probably the most -- it's very visible and easy to use and you don't even need to sign up, if you have a Google account.
e04aa5104d082e4a51d241391941ba26 (19:41): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762, IE had some stats about the quality of bug reports
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:41): Yes, I saw those.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:41): Basically, "the general public is a lot worse at filing bug reports than QA".
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:41): I hope so, or else you've got some pretty terrible QA.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:42): But QA will find different types of issues compared to the general public.

e04aa5104d082e4a51d241391941ba26 (19:46): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762, I'd like see a simpler "report a bug" function for the general public that is basically screenshot + bounding box + small comment
e04aa5104d082e4a51d241391941ba26 (19:46): and have QA/very technical audience do the rest
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (19:46): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, you really think :not(a.foo) should be like :not(a):not(.foo) ?
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (19:48): found that weird too
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:48): That doesn't make sense.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:48): :not(a.foo) should match <a> and <span class=foo>, just not <a class=foo>.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:49): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762, isn't that the same?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:49): 104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01, oh wait, hmm
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:50): 104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01, not anymore
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:50): should probably stay out of :not() debates

104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (19:50): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762, also, re: mozilla bugs, a few thoughts:  (1) Gecko bugs tend to get ignored when they're filed on Firefox instead of Core. (2) sometimes we have the bad habit of just ignoring bug reports we don't understand rather than saying "I don't understand this"
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (19:51): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, you should probably clarify, since so far there's been unanimous disagreement with what bzbarsky suggested

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:51): 104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01, (1) I always file against Core.  (2) All but one received responses, and I'm pretty sure the remaining one is comprehensible: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=586763
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:51): is pretty sure he files good bug reports, as a rule
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (19:52): Three people added themselves to the cc list, that's not ignored :)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:52): 104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01, replied to Paul Duffin who came to the same conclusion as bzbarsky
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:53): I said it got no response, not that it was ignored.  :)
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:53): Not that I'm saying it really needs a response.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:53): so Chromium people fix those kind of bugs instantly?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:54): seems weird
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:54): Not necessarily, it's just a general impression I get.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:56): I'm mostly annoyed at the lack of response to the WebKit bugs.  Not even confirmed.
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (19:57): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762, also, it's clear from the activity that bzbarsky saw it and cc:ed people on it; he just didn't say anything
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:57): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762, ask on webkit-dev about it?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:58): 104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01, my point was to compliment Mozilla's bug handling, relative to WebKit.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:58): Not to denigrate it.
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (19:58): ok, well, I'm glad you think it's good.
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (19:58): It could be better sometimes
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (19:58): but anyway
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:59): I can't really complain about the Mozilla bugs I've filed except to say they don't always get fixed, which is kind of inevitable.

e04aa5104d082e4a51d241391941ba26 (20:00): 104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01, if a bug gets reported to the wrong component someone should really tell the reporter and and re-triage it. I don't always know which component to report issues with
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:00): Which is why I didn't complain.  :)
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:00): Some of these are pretty trivial, maybe I'll submit a patch to fix another one.
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (20:01): Good, then I don't have to do it
104bc19e5513cba4eba2d18c7a704a01 (20:01): e04aa5104d082e4a51d241391941ba26, that usually happens if the component it starts with is something other than Firefox::General
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:17): jgraham, http://bitbucket.org/ms2ger/web-dom-core/changeset/562deb8e647e
e04aa5104d082e4a51d241391941ba26 (20:19): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762, https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=554 --> oldest open mozilla bug I could find ;-)

03341ab0742a44ea0478cab05ca96cac (20:19): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81: hi, I am curious what the comment on http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/elements.html#embedding-custom-non-visible-data means

e04aa5104d082e4a51d241391941ba26 (20:20): MikeSmith, <MikeSmith> :%s/\(^.*<h[1-6].\+\)\@<!\(\([AB]\.\)\?\([1-9][0-9]\?\.\)\+[1-9][0-9]\?\)\([^0-9]\)/<a href="#x\2">\2<\/a>\5/gc ---> are you trying to use regex to parse HTML?
03341ab0742a44ea0478cab05ca96cac (20:20): the implementation status says that WebKit does not pass all the relevent tests
03341ab0742a44ea0478cab05ca96cac (20:20): and I am curious what tests (other than the two linked there) it is referring to
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (20:20): Don't read too much into that
03341ab0742a44ea0478cab05ca96cac (20:20): so I can fix them :)
03341ab0742a44ea0478cab05ca96cac (20:20): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81: how much should I read into it
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (20:21): A rough indication at the very best
03341ab0742a44ea0478cab05ca96cac (20:22): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81: hm, ok, that is a bit confusing
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (20:22): It's got too many states to keep up to date
03341ab0742a44ea0478cab05ca96cac (20:23): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81: is there a way we should notifying people when they are wrong?
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (20:23): Change it yourself :)
03341ab0742a44ea0478cab05ca96cac (20:24): both very fair options, thanks!
